title: What will be the single discount equivalent to two successive discounts of 30% and 40%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends..…! Let selling price be ₹100 First Discount 30% = 30 × 100/100 = ₹30 Price after first discount = ₹100 – 30 = ₹70 Second discount 40% on price after first discount = 40/100 × 70 = ₹28 Price after second discount = ₹70 – 28 = ₹42 Net discount on selling price = 30 + 28 = 58 Answer: the single discount on two successive discount of 30% and 40% is 58%

Answer is 58%. Let M denotes the marked price. According to given data we have, Price after 1st discount of 30% = (1 - 0.30) * M = 0.7*M Price after 2nd discount of 40% = (1 - 0.40) * (0.7*M) = 0.42*M = (1 - 0.58) * M Hence a single discount of 58% is equivalent two successive discounts of 30% and 40%.
